column4: You have something like: twm &        in .xinitrc  or .xsession   ?
i just made an xinitrc in ~ and wrote twm in it. i then tried xinit... again a blank screen
You have more than one video output? Could be one not plugged in is being used for :0.0
my monitor section in xorg.conf is pretty plain
just identifier, horisync, vertrefresh, and displaysize
So your /home/username/.xinitrc   file has in it:   twm &                 with the ampersand?
no ampersand. let me try that
alright, now it starts up to a screen (still blank) and then quits
it does say "ddxSigGiveUp: closing log" at the end, but i don't think that it is important
When you installed X did you also install something like the right xserver-xorg-video-drivername   for your video card?
i915 is modprobed and seems to be working and under the video device in xorg i have intel as the driver.
Apologies on lag, it is late where I am. Did it require some other display than :0  or was it xorg.conf, something else?
i have no idea... xinit without an xinitrc starts x, but with it it won't. also if i type startx i get a blank screen.
